Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2011 05:16AM sbragg wrote: geocachelinda, Again, as with most things, it is different for many...my experience was good, for the most part...my homecare nurse removed them after about 10 days - I had 4 drains - for each, it was a bit of a "funny" sensation, a 1 second sting and some sensation of pulling and then over with! it was really quick! it is such a relief when they come out! it's amazing how long they are all tucked into the breast! I agree with one of the posts that suggested taking meds first...? I had muscle relaxers and Oxycodone and took those first..if your very nervous I think that if it's okay with your doctor, and you have someone to drive for you, why not enjoy the ride???! :) All the best - I wish you well, SherryÂ
Posts.Title: drainage tubes geocachelinda barbe1958
